linefit

Class GraphOptionsMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • linefit.GraphOptionsMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class GraphOptionsMenu
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This class handles the creation and the display of the graph options menu
    Since:
    <0.98.0
    Version:
    1.1
    Author:
    Unknown, Keith Rice
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  GraphOptionsMenu.GraphOptionsFrameLayout
      A Layout class that positions all the buttons and options in the frame
      private class  GraphOptionsMenu.GraphOptionsListener
      A generic listener class that picks up any button or checkbox event and handles it properly, either saving and closing or disable or enabling options and fields that are no longer applicable with the selected options

      The label for the graph name TextField
      private double[] graphSetsTempFixedValues
      An array of the values of the fixed varaible for each of the GraphDataSets so the user does not have to apply changes before modifying another GraphDataSet

      An array of ints that keeps track of what fixed variable is selected for each GraphDataSet so the user does not have to apply changes before modifying another GraphDataSet

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GraphOptionsMenu(GraphArea graphAreaToEditOptionsOf, DataSet currentSetInGraphArea, GeneralIO parentIoHandler)
      Creates the options frame and ties it back to our GraphArea so we can edit its values.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void applyChanges()
      Saves all the fields values from the options into the GraphArea so that the values actually get changed in the graph
      private void closeOptionsFrame()
      Closes this instance of the graph options frame
      private void resetToDefaults()
      This function when called restores the default start up option for the graph options
      (package private) void setCustomAxesEnabledStatus()
      Prevents the axis minimums and maximums from being changed when the custom axes box is not selected
      (package private) void setDataSetCanFixValueEnabledStatus()
      Prevents the fixed value and what is fixed from being changed if the dataset selected does not have a line fitted to it
      static void setElementBoundsIfVisible(java.awt.Component element, java.awt.Insets insets, int leftOffset, int topOffset, int width) 
      (package private) void setFixedValueEnabledStatus()
      Prevents the fixed value from being changed for individual linear fits when we have selected to have no fixed value
      (package private) void setPowersEnabledStatus()
      Disables and Enables the options for the powers on the axis based on whether or not the options are applicable with the current options
      (package private) void setResultOnGraphEnabledStatus()
      Prevents the results options fields from being edited when the results are not set to display on the graph
      private void setTabStops()
      Sets the order of the items when using the tabs key and other traversal keys
      (package private) void setTickLabelEnabledStatus()
      Disables and enables the different fields in the axis tick marks options section so that they are only enabled when they are applicable based on the other selections
      static void shiftElementGroup(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Component> componentsInGroup, int xShiftOfGroup, int yShiftOfGroup)
      Allows us to position groups of options together and allows us to to deal with larger chunks on the high level of building the graph options menu
      (package private) void updateFixValueForCurrDataSet()
      Changes the fixed value and what is fixed so it reflects the currently selected GraphDataSet
      private void updateGraphOptionsEnabledStatuses()
      This function is called when a checkbox has been toggled in the Graph Options menu and updates each block on the options to disable and enable parts that are relevant or not now that the option has been selected or deselcted

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphOptionsMenu

        GraphOptionsMenu(GraphArea graphAreaToEditOptionsOf,
                 DataSet currentSetInGraphArea,
                 GeneralIO parentIoHandler)
        Creates the options frame and ties it back to our GraphArea so we can edit its values. It is possible to have multiple GraphOptionFrames at once.
        Parameters:
        graphAreaToEditOptionsOf - the GraphArea whose options and settings will be edited
        currentSetInGraphArea - The currently selected GraphDataSet that is select in the given GraphArea
        parentIoHandler - The GeneralIO object used for handling IO related functionality

    • Method Detail

      • resetToDefaults

        private void resetToDefaults()
        This function when called restores the default start up option for the graph options

      • closeOptionsFrame

        private void closeOptionsFrame()
        Closes this instance of the graph options frame

      • setTabStops

        private void setTabStops()
        Sets the order of the items when using the tabs key and other traversal keys

      • setTickLabelEnabledStatus

        void setTickLabelEnabledStatus()
        Disables and enables the different fields in the axis tick marks options section so that they are only enabled when they are applicable based on the other selections

      • setPowersEnabledStatus

        void setPowersEnabledStatus()
        Disables and Enables the options for the powers on the axis based on whether or not the options are applicable with the current options

      • setCustomAxesEnabledStatus

        void setCustomAxesEnabledStatus()
        Prevents the axis minimums and maximums from being changed when the custom axes box is not selected

      • setResultOnGraphEnabledStatus

        void setResultOnGraphEnabledStatus()
        Prevents the results options fields from being edited when the results are not set to display on the graph

      • setFixedValueEnabledStatus

        void setFixedValueEnabledStatus()
        Prevents the fixed value from being changed for individual linear fits when we have selected to have no fixed value

      • setDataSetCanFixValueEnabledStatus

        void setDataSetCanFixValueEnabledStatus()
        Prevents the fixed value and what is fixed from being changed if the dataset selected does not have a line fitted to it

      • updateFixValueForCurrDataSet

        void updateFixValueForCurrDataSet()
        Changes the fixed value and what is fixed so it reflects the currently selected GraphDataSet

      • applyChanges

        void applyChanges()
        Saves all the fields values from the options into the GraphArea so that the values actually get changed in the graph

      • updateGraphOptionsEnabledStatuses

        private void updateGraphOptionsEnabledStatuses()
        This function is called when a checkbox has been toggled in the Graph Options menu and updates each block on the options to disable and enable parts that are relevant or not now that the option has been selected or deselcted

                                             java.awt.Insets insets,
                                             int leftOffset,
                                             int topOffset,
                                             int width)

      • shiftElementGroup

        public static void shiftElementGroup(java.util.ArrayList<java.awt.Component> componentsInGroup,
                                     int xShiftOfGroup,
                                     int yShiftOfGroup)
        Allows us to position groups of options together and allows us to to deal with larger chunks on the high level of building the graph options menu
        Parameters:
        componentsInGroup - The list of components that make up this group
        xShiftOfGroup - The y Location of the start of the group (from the top)
        yShiftOfGroup - The x Location of the start of the group (from the left)
